tweets.content: Trump is so optimistic about Liberation Day that he’s dumping his Truth Social stock, to the tune of over $2B, before our entire economy bottoms out like a Tesla Cybertruck hitting a pothole.

It’s LIBERATION DAY - Say it to yourself 3 times - LIBERATION DAY 

Trump’s tariffs will flip the economy back to the way it NEEDS TO BE in order to get us out of the rut we’ve been in since the last administration tried to destroy America from within 

Count on it

2025: President Trump announcing global tariffs, "We have Liberation Day on April 2nd"

1987: President Reagan explains how tariffs are bad for the economy, prosperity, lead to shrinking markets and job losses 

"Throughout the world there's a growing realisation that the way to

REPORTER: Do you think the president should move forward tomorrow with tariffs?  

MIKE JOHNSON: Look, you have to trust the president's instincts on the economy.

Trump bankrupted 6 casinos, but sure imposing tariffs will turn the economy around.
Liberation Day #TrumpTariffs

Trump calls it “Liberation Day,” but for America, it’s “Destruction Day!”

His tariffs aren’t liberating anyone, they’re killing jobs, wrecking trade, straining alliances, raising prices, and crushing our economy. 

RT if you oppose Trump’s so-called Liberation Day!

Dear Traders, 
April 2 Liberation Day is here. Expect serious volatility at 11:00 pm EAT. Let's not have cases of blown accounts. The tariffs will likely cause a huge transfer of wealth.

Liberation Day:

The day Trump announces tariffs to raise our costs, crush our economy, and then tell us that our economic struggles are “freedom.”

We’re free — to spend more and get a lot less, while he golfs with oligarchs at the country club he owns.
“Liberation Day” for America may go down in the history books—not as the celebration that Donald Trump intends but as economic malpractice of the highest order

“Liberation Day” is tomorrow! 

I think globalists are just using Trump to destroy the US economy.

Using tariffs to rebuild manufacturing is like taxing donuts and pizza to make people lose weight.

But experience is always the best teacher. 

So, go ahead with the trade war!
